alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 12:27PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marion County through 115 PM CDT... At 1227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hamilton, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Winfield, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Gu- Win, Brinn, Lake Buttahatchee, Bear Creek, Twin, Tucker, Tessner, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Marion County Public Lake, Piney Grove and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
